definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
seal (of office)/seal script (a calligraphic style)/the small seal 小篆 and great seal 大篆/writing in seal script
quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals
to have no basis in fact (idiom)
differing only slightly/not much between them

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
equally true for (all the rest)/the same thing applies (for everyone)
faking a modern object as an ancient one
drumming on a bowl in grief (idiom, refers to Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 grieving for his lost wife)/fig. grief for a lost wife
dispensing praise or blame with a single word (idiom)/concise and powerful style
lit. lock the door and search for the right word (idiom); fig. the serious hard work of writing
